snippet: Though there is much ado about the area’s growth, it is a different story for some Asian households, which fell deeper into poverty even after the recession ended.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column cites New York City study that has found poverty rate in Queens rose by 6 percentage points from 2008 to 2012, highest increase of any borough; notes much of that jump was related to struggles of Asian New Yorkers, half of whom live in the borough.
lead_paragraph: Though there is much ado about the area’s growth, it is a different story for some Asian households, which fell deeper into poverty even after the recession ended.

headline.main: In a Flourishing Queens, Prosperity Eludes Some Asian Families
headline.print_headline: Prosperity Eludes Some Asian Families in Queens
